p:
The second most common virus identified in this study population was Influenza B virus (6.5%); however, the proportion was much lower compared to a recent survey from East India, where Influenza B was reported as the leading cause of ARI with 12% prevalence.
13 A recent report from India attributed 40% hospitalizations in children to influenza B infections,
19 however, in our study population, influenza B infection was predominantly found in patients aged 30–50 years and was mild. Seasonal influenza A(H3N2) virus also caused mild respiratory infection in <5% of the our study population; mostly in children aged 0–5 years due to their non-exposure to this virus previously.
